post.summary: [EXPERIMENTAL] UploadImage: Uploads an image to be used for Scheduler jobs
post.description: Every image must have at least one tag

400.description: The details of the input related failure

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
The pagination token to use to continue listing images from a previous call to list images.
            This value is returned from the previous call. If a pagination token is provided the sortBy and filter fields
            must not have changed since the original request. Also, if set, a start value cannot be provided.

schema.description:
The pagination token to use to continue listing images from a previous call to list images.
            This value is returned from the previous call. If a pagination token is provided the sortBy and filter fields
            must not have changed since the original request. Also, if set, a start value cannot be provided.

parameters.name: sortBy
parameters.description: Order the results by these fields. Use use the '-' sign to denote descending order e.g. -MyFieldName.

schema.description: Order the results by these fields. Use use the '-' sign to denote descending order e.g. -MyFieldName.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: When paginating, skip this number of results.

schema.description: When paginating, skip this number of results.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: When paginating, limit the number of returned results to this many. Defaults to 2000 if not specified. Maximum is 5000.

schema.description: When paginating, limit the number of returned results to this many. Defaults to 2000 if not specified. Maximum is 5000.

passedAs.description:
Specifies how this argument should be passed in
Allowed values are: CommandLine or EnvironmentVariable

Defaults to: CommandLine

defaultValue.description:
Specify a default value for this argument if no value is provided
The value needs to be convertible to the associated data type

dateCreated.description: Date when job was created. Defaults to now.

imageName.description: The name of the Docker image that contains this job

imageTag.description: The tag of the Docker image that contains this job

command.description: The command for running this job

ttl.description:
Time To Live of the job run in seconds
Defaults to 5 minutes(300)

minCpu.description:
Specifies  minimum number of CPUs to be allocated for the job
Default to 2

maxCpu.description: Specifies  maximum number of CPUs to be allocated for the job

minMemory.description: Specifies the minimum amount of memory  to be allocated for the job

maxMemory.description: Specifies the maximum amount of memory to be allocated for the job

argumentDefinitions.description: All arguments for this job to run

commandLineArgumentSeparator.description:
Value to separate command line arguments
e.g : If a job has a command line argument named 'folder' and the runtime value is 's3://path' then this
would be supplied to the command as 'folder{separatorValue}s3://path'
Default to a space

name.description: A display name for this Schedule

author.description: Name of the author of this schedule

owner.description: Name of owner of this schedule

arguments.description: All arguments specified by this Schedule that will be passed in to the Job

enabled.description:
Specify whether schedule is enabled or not
Defaults to true

pushTime.description: The push time of the image

pullTime.description: The latest pull time of the image

size.description: The size of the image (in bytes)

Image.description: Represents the metadata of an image

pushTime.description: The push time of the image

pullTime.description: The latest pull time of the image

size.description: The size of the image (in bytes)

scanStatus.description: The Scan Status of the stated image

ImageSummary.description: Represents the metadata of an image

dockerImage.description: Information about the docker image in the format image_source/image_name:image_tag

command.description: The command for running this job

ttl.description:
Time To Live of the job run in seconds
Defaults to 5 minutes(300)

minCpu.description:
Specifies  minimum number of CPUs to be allocated for the job
Default to 2

maxCpu.description: Specifies  maximum number of CPUs to be allocated for the job

minMemory.description: Specifies the minimum amount of memory (in GiB) to be allocated for the job

maxMemory.description: Specifies the maximum amount of memory (in GiB) to be allocated for the job

argumentDefinitions.description: All arguments for this job to run

commandLineArgumentSeparator.description:
Value to separate command line arguments
e.g : If a job has a command line argument named 'folder' and the runtime value is 's3://path' then this
would be supplied to the command as 'folder{separatorValue}s3://path'
Default to a space

runId.description: Unique id of the job run

initialisedDate.description: The date when the job was initialised

startDate.description: The date when the job started running in Scheduler

endDate.description:
End date of the job
Defaults to null if the job has not started or not completed yet
If value is null and job has not started, status will be `Pending`
If value is null and job has not completed, but is running, status will be `Running`

arguments.description: All arguments used in in this job run

environmentVariables.description: All environment variables used in this job run

resultUrl.description: URI to results. Defaults to null if not available

manuallyTriggeredBy.description:
UserId of the user that triggered the job.
Defaults to null if job was ran on a Schedule

command.description: The command used to run the job

message.description:
Output message generated by the job runner
Value will be null when the job is in a `Running` or `Pending` status

consoleOutputUrl.description: The URL for the console output of the job run

runId.description: Unique id of the job run

initialisedDate.description: The date when the job was initialised

startDate.description: The date when the job started running in Scheduler

endDate.description:
End date of the job
Defaults to null if the job has not started or not completed yet
If value is null and job has not started, status will be `Pending`
If value is null and job has not completed, but is running, status will be `Running`

arguments.description: All arguments used in in this job run

environmentVariables.description: All environment variables used in this job run

resultUrl.description: URI to results. Defaults to null if not available

manuallyTriggeredBy.description:
UserId of the user that triggered the job.
Defaults to null if job was ran on a Schedule

command.description: The command used to run the job

message.description:
Output message generated by the job runner
Value will be null when the job is in a `Running` or `Pending` status

destination.description: Where the notification should be sent

lastUpdate.description: The last update of the repository

pullCount.description: Number of times images were pulled from this repository

imageCount.description: The number of versions of this image

Repository.description: An object representation of a repository

lusidApis.description: List of LUSID APIs the job needs access to

lusidFileSystem.description: List of S3 bucket or folder names that the job can access

externalCalls.description: External URLs that the job can call

RequiredResources.description: Information related to a jobs required access to resources

severity.description: The overall severity. For example : "High" or "None"

startTime.description: The start time of the scanning process

endTime.description: The end time of the scanning process

scanDuration.description: The duration of the scan in seconds

ScanReport.description: Represents the details of a security scan of an image

fixable.description: The number of vulnerabilities that have a known fix

critical.description: The number of Critical severity vulnerabilities

high.description: The number of High severity vulnerabilities

medium.description: The number of Medium severity vulnerabilities

low.description: The number of Low severity vulnerabilities

negligible.description: The number of Negligible severity vulnerabilities

unknown.description: The number of Unknown severity vulnerabilities

name.description: A display name for this Schedule

author.description: Name of the author of this schedule

owner.description: Name of owner of this schedule

arguments.description: All arguments specified by this Schedule that will be passed in to the Job
All arguments needed for the Job to run

runId.description: Unique RunId of the started job run

status.description: Link to the status of the started job

result.description: Link to the result of the job run when completed

runId.description: Unique RunId of the started schedule

result.description: Link to the result of the job run when completed

StartScheduleResponse.description: Response from a manual run of a schedule

pushTime.description: The date of the tag's push

signed.description: Indicates whether the tag is signed

immutable.description: Indicates whether the tag is immutable

Tag.description: Represents data of an image's tag

timeZone.description: Time zone of the Cron expression. If not provided, defaults to UTC

Trigger.description:
Holds different kinds of triggers
A schedule may only have one type of trigger

imageName.description: The name of the Docker image that contains this job

imageTag.description: The tag of the Docker image that contains this job

command.description: The command for running this job

Time To Live of the job run in seconds
Defaults to 5 minutes(300)

Specifies  minimum number of CPUs to be allocated for the job

UpdateJobRequest.description: A request to update a job

name.description: The updated name of the schedule

description.description: The updated description of the schedule

author.description: The updated author of the schedule

owner.description: The update owner of the schedule

arguments.description:
Updated arguments to be passed to the job
Note: The new arguments will completely replace old arguments

enabled.description:
Specify whether schedule is enabled or not
Defaults to true

imageName.description: Name of the image to be uploaded

UploadImageRequest.description: Request to upload image for Scheduler use

package.description: The package that contains the vulnerability

fixVersion.description: The version that has a fix for the vulnerability (if known)
